intro: Cerinthe major var. gymnandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaved toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces striking blue or violet flowers with a distinctive spurred petal, typical of the Boraginaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
